The paella was slimy.  The crab tapas was a little crusty because it was covered in mayonnaise and was sitting out a little too long.  The tomato/prosciutto/egg/caviar tapas was too salty to even eat.  The house wine is good and the ambience is nice, so stop in here for a quick drink, but do yourself a favor and skip the tapas.  Other places are much better, and this place isn't so cheap once you start adding everything up.  Pass!!
